vocabulary.example: break up with (someone) [phv] - end a relationship with (someone)

questions.question: Jenny's offer came at a ______ time for Rob.
Rob broke up with his girlfriend _______ he met Jenny.
Jenny doesn't have a boyfriend because ______.
options: she can't find a nice guy

questions.question: Rob leaves because ______.
options: he is not interested in Jenny

questions.question: Jenny thinks that it is easier to get a taxi by ______.
options: using an app on her phone

grammar.explanation: Choose the grammatically correct word to complete the sentence, focusing on gerunds, infinitives, or sentence structure. Each question has one correct answer and three incorrect options.

exercises.sentence: It's been great ___ in New York.
Your offer ___ here came at a very good time.
I've been too busy recently ___ about relationships.
___ this job was a really big thing for me.
Only ___ about work isn't very good for you.
I think I should ___ back to the hotel now.
It's much easier ___ a cab on the street.

transcript.full:
Rob: That was a lovely meal. Thanks Jenny.

Jenny: That's okay.

Rob: It's been great being in New York. You know your offer to work here came at a very good time for me.

Jenny: Really?

Rob: Yeah. I was looking for something new. Something different. You see, I broke up with my girlfriend a few months before I met you.

Jenny: Oh. Right.

Rob: What about you?

Jenny: What about me?

Rob: You know. Relationships.

Jenny: I've been too busy recently to think about relationships. Getting this job at the magazine was a really big thing for me. I guess that's taken up all my time and energy.

Rob: But that isn't very good for you. Only thinking about work, I mean.

Jenny: Why didn't you tell me you weren't feeling well this morning? We didn't have to go for a run.

Rob: I wanted to go. It was nice.

Jenny: Well, I'm glad you're feeling better. Would you like another coffee?

Rob: No thanks. I think I should get back to the hotel now. I've got a really busy day tomorrow. Do you have a telephone number for a taxi?

Jenny: Yeah, but it's much easier to get a cab on the street.

Rob: Okay then.

Jenny: I'll see you in the morning if you're feeling okay.

Rob: Oh, I'm sure I'll be fine. Thanks again for a great evening.

Jenny: Anytime.

Rob: Good night.

Jenny: Night Rob.
